p: In our study, 30 out of the 89 subjects who used drugs had a co-infection. These results highlighted the necessity of routine HCV testing for T. pallidum infected individuals [ 29], and also suggested that preventing syphilis should be included as a part of HBV control strategies. Targeted trainings for physicians and expanded syphilis screening services for HBV positive individuals are urgently needed [ 30, 31].
